tum.dss.thesis.lsframework

Class AbstractPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • tum.dss.thesis.lsframework.AbstractPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, PlayerInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Player

    public abstract class AbstractPlayer
extends Object
implements Serializable, PlayerInterface
    Abstract player which implements basic methods to set valuations and retrieve valuation using an oracle access to maintain polynomial time.
    Author:
    Florian Stallmann
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • AbstractPlayer

        public AbstractPlayer(String name,
                      int subsets)
        Initializes player with name and number of item subsets.

        Note that the number of subsets is used to initialize the hashmap for the valuations. So for a 2-minded player it is sufficient to pass 2 as the number of subsets.

        Parameters:
        name - name of player.
        subsets - number of subsets.

      • setValuations

        public void setValuations(double[] val)
        Description copied from interface: PlayerInterface
        Sets the valuation for all subsets (override existing).

        The index of the array must equal the index of the subset. The array has to be monotone as this method will not check for monotonicity.

        Specified by:
        setValuations in interface PlayerInterface
        Parameters:
        val - valuation as double array.

      • setValuation

        public void setValuation(int j,
                         double val)
        Description copied from interface: PlayerInterface
        Sets a single valuation for given subset index (takes care of monotonicity automatically).

        This method is the implementation of the first part of Claim 3.3. It will monotonize the valuation of this player for all supersets. If a subset has a higher valuation this this update will be skipped. Hence, it is not possible to decrease a valuation if a subset with a higher valuation already exists. It is important that each time the ellipsoid method updates all player valuation the resetValuation method is called before. This happens in EllipsoidMethodData.updatePlayerValuation(org.jscience.mathematics.vector.Vector).

        Specified by:
        setValuation in interface PlayerInterface
        Parameters:
        j - index of set.
        val - valuation.

      • findMostValuableSubset

        protected int findMostValuableSubset(int j)
        Finds subset of j which has the highest value, returns -1 if no subset found.
        Parameters:
        j - index of set.
        Returns:
        index of subset with highest valuation, otherwise -1 if not existent.
